thread.title: Luxury Real Estate Comes to Urban Chinatowns

author: Katy McLaughlin
title: Luxury Real Estate Comes to Urban Chinatowns

organizations.name: luxury real estate comes to urban chinatowns robert arsenault

text:
Robert Arsenault, an international economic development consultant in Philadelphia, spends $2,540 a month for his two-bedroom in the Goldtex, a luxury building with a concierge, gym and a rooftop pool. His favorite amenity, though, is outside: a slew of authentic Chinese restaurants specializing in everything from Szechuan cuisine to dim sum.
“I eat in Chinatown three to five times a week,” when in town, explains Mr. Arsenault, 64, who is not of Chinese ancestry. He says he moved near the city's Chinatown to enjoy its “really...
